captions.text: 'Stalker flip side story'
When you bite your lips twice and blink once
your lips always spill the same lies
The moment you called him 'just another friend'
You've become just another hoe, listen
You'll never be able to get rid of that habit of yours
And I'm not playing detective anymore
I gave you a chance but you just blew it, you're sick
Watch now, this is how I'm gonna fuck you up
You said you were tired, you were going to bed
And I knew something was up
How long did you think I'd be fooled?
You must've thought I'm stupid as hell

I'm out, have a nice life
This is like some song lyrics
You and I have no way out now

Only if you were honest once
I would've let it all go
But you dragged me down to my worst
I pull myself together, and a tear drops
I find myself walking to your house
Like someone drew all over my heart
I feel pain as if it's been carved out
But in the mirror, I'm still trying to smile
Leave me alone
Die out like a candle in the wind
Get out of my house
Elegant bitch? Not you
Just a sly one
Elegant bitch? Not you
Just the biggest bitch of all
I'm standing outside your door

You said you were home 
Why is your door locked?
How shocking is it to run into me at 1PM?
I'm about to go crazy and lose myself
You were out because of church
It's not what I think with the person you met
Oh I see, you were busy with a church friend
What, you two had the urge to pray at 2AM?
Please, be reasonable for once
Give me something I can try to buy
Then you start asking why I don't trust you
Walking away saying you're tired
Because like always
You thought I'd be like some homeless dog
clinging on to you, but bitch please not today
Fuck, I really loved youbut you didn't
I pull myself together, and a tear drops
I find myself walking to your house
Like someone drew all over my heart
I feel pain as if it's been carved out
But in the mirror, I'm still trying to smile
Leave me alone
Die out like a candle in the wind
Get out of my house
Elegant bitch? Not you
Just a sly one
Elegant bitch? Not you
Just the biggest bitch of all
I wish you could live my life for a day
You'll see how I burned up inside
After all you've done and all I've seen
I still asked you to come back, how crazy
But you're not worth it anymore

Even when I convinced myself
I could try to mend this
you stabbed me in the back so
Whatever, fuck off
You're nothing
I really loved you once but not anymore
'Stalker flip side story'

comments.text:
The lyrics are a bit strong but hey! You certainly wouldn't speak about 
love and treason with dictionary-worthy words, would you? I like to see 
this kind if songs, I don't know much about men but his songs are really 
eye opening, now I understand how my brother felt during his past 
relationships, men do not act the same way women do very often, my mom says 
that cheating on a guy is the worst thing a woman can do, same goes for men 
with women but men do not ever recover from cheating, perhaps women don't 
either but women are more likely to come to terms with the whole situation, 
that's just me﻿

anger and frustrations. I feel there is nothing wrong with the lyrics. ﻿

comments.author: 김용순

comments.text:
He's an underground rapper. Do you guys think he's going to censor himself 
in something he is releasing personally and have no kpop idol hooked on it? 
People who are in outrage need to understand that there are other scenes of 
music in k-music other than the censored kpop. For example, look at all the 
underground artists who are in kpop groups now, compare their mix tapes to 
what they release now. They are so much tamer. (Zico, Kyung, etc.) I really 
hate people who say "I like Korean music because it's so much nicer than 
trashy American music." Those people have really closed-off POVs because 
they don't see the American scene past top 40. There are plenty of other 
artists that are not trashy or going the easy route to sell music. There 
are rappers who write deep lyrics, just like in Korea, they just aren't in 
the front lines of being famous because people like listening to the 
"trashy rap". They see money, they continue to write trash. Hop off the 
Korea is so pure and awesome, music so deep not trashy, mindset and explore 
their music and any music with an open mind. Some you hate, some you like, 
but don't generalize a scene.

Also I'm a big supporter of feminism, but I'm not jumping up to arms 
because he called some girl a "bitch" or a "ho" because honestly, I'd call 
people that if they betrayed me in some way. He isn't going into the whole 
"Let me berate and look down upon women." like you say he is because if he 
was his lyrics would be "Let me jump into the club, all them bitches be on 
my d'" He is generalizing women at the club for wanting him and hints at 
them being sluts and etc. In this rap, he is venting anger and frustration. 
He was cheated on, he's mad. It's a normal reaction to betrayal of someone 
you believed loved you. Would you be happy if someone betrayed you? You'd 
be mad or sad, depending on your relationship with said person. If he 
wasn't going to use the English words that pop out so much since we 
understand English and not Korean off the bat, he would've used the Korean 
equivalents and I don't doubt people would be up in arms as much. Korea 
uses curse words just as much as the rest of the world. It's not like he 
plastered the son in "F' you's" and "bitch and ho". (Sometimes that's what 
ruins Eminem's raps for me. The context is good but then there's too many 
f'bombs everywhere and cursing that it ruins the song and you can't take 
him seriously, but that's because of amount, not because of the words.

No one got upset at GD for using "geu saekki" (not that harsh of a curse 
word, but in the context it was derogatory) towards a guy that had the girl 
that he liked in the song. If idk BTS came out with something, calling out 
the people who looked down on them, and it had curse words, fans would step 
up and say "Wow, so edgy. They aren't afraid to be "real"" (Oh wait, they 
did release multiple tracks like thisand the fan response was as i said.) 
Jump off the high horse, and don't compare these people to your moral 
standards. Just because you don't curse, doesn't mean they don't have to. 
Just because you want to them not to curse because they are public figure, 
doesn't mean they have to, especially people who are not selling themselves 
as idols to the youth of today. They are human beings, with feelings that 
they want to express in their own words. Don't look down on their feelings 
or their work just because you don't like them. It's like me going up to 
something you made, made assumptions about you, and degraded you. ﻿

comments.text:
No problem. It's just I'm tired of people trying to censor the world. I'm 
all for people talking intellectually and limiting curse words (I don't 
curse a lot in real life. It's not sprinkled in every sentence or even 
every day) But that's like saying I haven't cursed someone.

I'm sure everyone being mad at him has for sure called out someone they 
don't like (personally know or a celebrity) and said some awful things. I 
call people "son of a bitch", "bitch" etc. (I've never called anyone a slut 
or whore because I'm not gonna judge peeps on how active they are sexually)

All for feminism but rabid internet feminism who don't understand what 
feminism truly is or "equality" in general ruin the movement. shrug

comments.text:
If you don't like the lyrics here, stop listening to the song. It obviously 
isn't aimed towards you - it's based off his story or feelings about a 
cheater. If you wrote music you probably wouldn't write "silly boy" or 
"butthead" about a guy that cheated on you and hurt you, right? This is his 
way of expressing himself. Respect him and what he does - don't degrade his 
work for his word choice. Just move on and let other people actually enjoy 
it﻿
